intro: Pseudanthistiria burmanica, commonly known as Burmese star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that resemble star anise. The plant produces dark brown, aromatic fruits that are used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include compound leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is often found in moist, forested habitats.
